choices.A: The UAG must be using a 2 NIC deployment
choices.D: Must deploy the UAG via PowerShell method
choices.B: Cascade mode architecture must be implemented
choices.C: HA Proxy service must be running

questions.question_text: Which is a requirement for TLS port sharing on the Unified Access Gateway (UAG)?

choices.B: Integrate with a second LDAP forest
choices.D: Set a different set of privacy settings

discussion.content:
Also vote for A, D, F
you can also turn the question this way: Which settings can only be applied at OG level ?
Not B because you can create a new user group to integrate your second LDAP and the use that user group in your smart group.

questions.question_text: Which are three reasons an administrator would need to create an Organizational Group instead of using a Smart Group? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Confirm Correct Answer is A, D:

https://techzone.vmware.com/blog/updated-vmware-workspace-one-reference-architecture-saas-deployments

comments.content:
You can implement VMware Identity Manager using on-premises or SaaS-based implementation models. No necessary always need to be on-premises.
So answer should be B, E

https://techzone.vmware.com/sites/default/files/resource/vmware_workspace_one_reference_architecture_for_saas_deployments.pdf

I agree. I miss understood the question. As the messaging components are in inside the cloud components and vIDM is deployed in cloud in a SaaS deployments, the only options are the Connectors or Gateways. In this case B and E! Thank you!
The UAG and VMware Tunnel are optional components. Otherwise, Airwatch and IDM Gateways are must do if you want to connect to SaaS Workspace Environment.

questions.question_text: For a hybrid SaaS customer, what Workspace ONE components would always need to be installed On-premises? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B is correct!
VMware Tunnel is configured and configures a certificate to provide local single sign-on services to third-party Android applications connected to VMware Identity Manager.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE/services/ws1_quickconguration/GUID-73B7A11A-090D-4698-BEB8-91F8989B1EFC.html
It would either be A or Vmware Tunnel App

SSO android needs a specific configuration to work : device traffic rule configured to proxy flows through IDM (port 5262). 
I ll choose Tunnel app but VMware Tunnek cannot the right answer.
I would go for B, "VMware Tunnel" since Android use Per App Tunnel

questions.question_text:
An organization's newly deployed Workspace ONE Mobile SSO works correctly for Windows 10 and iOS devices, but fails for Android devices.
What Workspace ONE component is likely the cause of this issue?

A customer plans to incorporate VMware Horizon resources in their Digital Workspace solutions using VMware Workspace ONE.
Which directory service integration is required to support this design?

choices.D: Active Directory integration into Workspace ONE IDM using IDM Connector
choices.C: Workspace ONE UEM Integration Services vIDM
choices.B: Active Directory integration into Workspace ONE UEM using Cloud Connector
choices.A: LDAP integration into Workspace ONE IDM using IDM Connector
